trans-unit.source: This topic explains concepts you'll need to understand before you start deploying apps with Intune.
trans-unit.target: This topic explains concepts you'll need to understand before you start deploying apps with Intune.

trans-unit.source: This topic explains some of the concepts you need to understand before you start deploying apps with Microsoft Intune.
trans-unit.target: This topic explains some of the concepts you need to understand before you start deploying apps with Microsoft Intune.

trans-unit.source: When you deploy apps, you can choose from one of the following deployment actions:
trans-unit.target: When you deploy apps, you can choose from one of the following deployment actions:

trans-unit.source: **Required install** – The app is installed onto the device with no user intervention required.
trans-unit.target: **Required install** – The app is installed onto the device with no user intervention required.

trans-unit.source: For iOS devices that are not in supervised mode, and for all Android devices, the user must accept the app offer before it is installed.
trans-unit.target: For iOS devices that are not in supervised mode, and for all Android devices, the user must accept the app offer before it is installed.

trans-unit.source: If a user uninstalls an app that you deployed as a required install, Intune automatically reinstalls the app after the next inventory cycle, which typically occurs every seven days.
trans-unit.target: If a user uninstalls an app that you deployed as a required install, Intune automatically reinstalls the app after the next inventory cycle, which typically occurs every seven days.

trans-unit.source: **Available install** – The app is displayed in the company portal, and users can install it on demand.
trans-unit.target: **Available install** – The app is displayed in the company portal, and users can install it on demand.

trans-unit.source: **Uninstall** – The app is uninstalled from the device.
trans-unit.target: **Uninstall** – The app is uninstalled from the device.

trans-unit.source: **Not applicable** – The app is not displayed in the company portal and is not installed on any devices.
trans-unit.target: **Not applicable** – The app is not displayed in the company portal and is not installed on any devices.

trans-unit.source: Understand which deployment actions are available for each installer type
trans-unit.target: Understand which deployment actions are available for each installer type

trans-unit.source: Windows app package (deployed to a user group)
trans-unit.target: Windows app package (deployed to a user group)

trans-unit.source: Windows app package (deployed to a device group)
trans-unit.target: Windows app package (deployed to a device group)

trans-unit.source: App package for mobile devices (deployed to a user group)
trans-unit.target: App package for mobile devices (deployed to a user group)

trans-unit.source: App package for mobile devices (deployed to a device group)
trans-unit.target: App package for mobile devices (deployed to a device group)

trans-unit.source: Windows Installer (deployed to a user group)
trans-unit.target: Windows Installer (deployed to a user group)

trans-unit.source: Windows Installer (deployed to a device group)
trans-unit.target: Windows Installer (deployed to a device group)

trans-unit.source: External link (deployed to a user group)
trans-unit.target: External link (deployed to a user group)

trans-unit.source: External link (deployed to a device group)
trans-unit.target: External link (deployed to a device group)

trans-unit.source: Managed iOS app from the app store (deployed to a user group)
trans-unit.target: Managed iOS app from the app store (deployed to a user group)

trans-unit.source: Managed iOS app from the app store (deployed to a device group)
trans-unit.target: Managed iOS app from the app store (deployed to a device group)

trans-unit.source: When you deploy apps, if you select both user and device groups, you can only deploy the app as an **Available install**.
trans-unit.target: When you deploy apps, if you select both user and device groups, you can only deploy the app as an **Available install**.

trans-unit.source: When two deployments with the same deployment action are received by a device, the following rules apply:
trans-unit.target: When two deployments with the same deployment action are received by a device, the following rules apply:

trans-unit.source: Deployments to a device group take precedence over deployments to a user group.
trans-unit.target: Deployments to a device group take precedence over deployments to a user group.

trans-unit.source: However, if an app is deployed to a user group with a deployment action of **Available**, and the same app is also deployed to a device group with a deployment action of **Not Applicable**, the app will be made available in the company portal for users to install.
trans-unit.target: However, if an app is deployed to a user group with a deployment action of **Available**, and the same app is also deployed to a device group with a deployment action of **Not Applicable**, the app will be made available in the company portal for users to install.

trans-unit.source: An install action takes precedence over an uninstall action.
trans-unit.target: An install action takes precedence over an uninstall action.

trans-unit.source: If both a required and an available install are received by a device, the actions are combined.
trans-unit.target: If both a required and an available install are received by a device, the actions are combined.

trans-unit.source: In other words, the user can install the available app from the company portal before the required install begins.
trans-unit.target: In other words, the user can install the available app from the company portal before the required install begins.

trans-unit.source: Learn how to [deploy apps in Microsoft Intune](deploy-apps-in-microsoft-intune.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn how to [deploy apps in Microsoft Intune](deploy-apps-in-microsoft-intune.md).
